Duck2010

Getting familiar with the group...

94

0

0

Alabama

Hyundai Motor of America. has just made a offer to buy my 2010 4.6 back. with all of this said i was thinking about buying a Rspec i have found one in the price range i want. $ 39,990 but for those of you who has went from a 4.6 to a 5.0 was it worth the extra money?

the 5.0 that i have found is in NC. and also did your insurance go up any? i plan on calling progressive to find out.. any info will be welcome or if you know where a black genesis 5.0 is in the southeast let me know..

Thanks.

Potty_Pants

4

Hyundai Motor of America. has just made a offer to buy my 2010 4.6 back. with all of this said i was thinking about buying a Rspec i have found one in the price range i want. $ 39,990 but for those of you who has went from a 4.6 to a 5.0 was it worth the extra money?

the 5.0 that i have found is in NC. and also did your insurance go up any? i plan on calling progressive to find out.. any info will be welcome or if you know where a black genesis 5.0 is in the southeast let me know..

Thanks.

there are upgrades going from the 4.6 to 5.0, nothing crazy but a few...

side moldings, lit door plates, stiffer suspension, rspec floor mats (adds 10hp... race car).

doesnt the 5.0 over the 4.6 have DI... so thats a difference too.

I would say the insurance increases but not a deal breaker.

good luck

ppp

Duck, are you leasing or did you buy you car? I'm wondering if these offers are given to to both buyers and leasees?

EXBMWGUY

Been here awhile...

1,380

2

0

Twin Cities, Minnesota

As a point of view on the question of insurance costs on the R-Spec, we just got our six-month renewal on a two-car policy bundled with homeowners and a $1 million insurance umbrella from Travelers.

For those who are interested, we have good driving records, are over 55, etc., living in greater Twin Cities metro. We each drive around 20k per year and have $500,000 bodily injury, $500,000 liability, collision and comprehensive with $500 deductible, personal injury protection, uninsured motorist, $500,000 underinsured motorist liability, medical, towing, and full glass/0 deductible coverage, etc. etc.

Cars:

2012 Genesis R-Spec - six month premium: $261

2012 Volvo XC60 AWD with 300hp T6; six-month premium: $271.

I realize this will vary significantly from others' premiums for a lot if reasons. However, what's amazing is that the Volvo is more expensive to insure, and its safety features exceed the already good safety features of the Genny. The Volvo MSRP was about 51k, but still??

OBTW, I'm not soliciting critique on my policy from insurance pros here.

Please vote today - for something.

Cars:

I realize this will vary significantly from others' premiums for a lot if reasons. However, what's amazing is that the Volvo is more expensive to insure, and its safety features exceed the already good safety features of the Genny. The Volvo MSRP was about 51k, but still??

Your insurance company probably has insufficient statistics on the R-Spec to rate it a higher risk than any other Genesis V8. If you look at the Comprehensive portion of the premium, that should show how much is attributed to difference in MSRP between the Volvo and the R-Spec. The primary aspect of comprehensive is theft, and damage due to natural disaster, etc.

OR

It's nice when an accident happens I'm only charged $100 of my $250 deductable also

$1,000 is the deductable of my house insurance!

Duck, just one question though. What happens if your R-Spec pulls to one side as well? My 2010 pulled and it didn't get resolved until I went to an independent alignment shop and got a 4 wheel laser alignment done (paid for out of my own pocket, of course). My 2012 pulls ever-so- slightly, and I will probably have the same thing done.

I will say that the Genesis is *very* sensitive to the crown on the road. I've been on some roads and felt it pulling one way and been on others and felt it pulling the other way.

I will say that the Genesis is *very* sensitive to the crown on the road. I've been on some roads and felt it pulling one way and been on others and felt it pulling the other way.

Tires matter. Some tires are hard and give great gas mileage but are noisy and exhibit a significant amount of tire pull. Tires that are more sensitive to pull will be very sensitive to slight camber variances as well as road imperfections.

Read this thread for my experience with my new tires
